FuncDef: The test connectivity command performs a connectivity test on ATM services.
CLIs: test connectivity interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> } { pvc <vpi/vci> | pvp <vpi> } llid <llid-value>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type of an interface.
Global-Ima-Group sub-interface, Ima-Group sub-interface, and ATM serial sub-interface.

Specifies the number of an interface.
-

Specifies a virtual path identifier (VPI)/virtual channel identifier (VCI).
vpi: The value is an integer, and its range varies with the interface type.
UNI interface: The value ranges from 0 to 255.NNI interface: The value ranges from 0 to 4095.
vci: The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 2 and from 5 to 65535. Generally, the VCI value 65535 is reserved for special use and it is recommended that this value not be used.

Specifies a VPI.
The value is an integer, and its range varies with the interface type.
UNI interface: The value ranges from 0 to 255.NNI interface: The value ranges from 0 to 4095.

Specifies a remote LLID.
The value is a string of 16 characters, in hexadecimal notation. A hyphen (-) is added between each two characters, and the value format is xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx. An LLID cannot contain only Fs.

Specifies the name of an interface.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI] test connectivity interface serial1/0/0:0 pvp 10 llid 01-02-03-04-05-06-07-08-09-10-11-12-13-14-15-16
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After ATM cell relay has been configured on an ATM interface, you can run the test connectivity command to perform a connectivity test on the ATM services.
Pre-configuration Tasks
The physical layer and protocol layer status of the interface on which the connectivity test will be performed is Up. If the interface is a synchronous serial interface, ATM has been configured as the interface's link layer protocol.A PVC or PVP has been configured on the interface.The end-point attribute is configured for the connection point of the PVC or PVP on the device that initiates the connectivity test.Both the local and remote devices have an LLID configured using the llid command.

Precautions
Interfaces that support ATM service connectivity tests include synchronous serial interfacesand IMA-group sub-interfaces channelized from a CPOS E1 interface and CE1 interfaces.
